speaker: DERBY
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: SCENE I. Salisbury. An open place.

speaker: DERBY
text_entry: Enter the Sheriff, and BUCKINGHAM, with halberds, led to execution

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Will not King Richard let me speak with him?

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: No, my good lord; therefore be patient.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Hastings, and Edward's children, Rivers, Grey,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Holy King Henry, and thy fair son Edward,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Vaughan, and all that have miscarried

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: By underhand corrupted foul injustice,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: If that your moody discontented souls

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Do through the clouds behold this present hour,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Even for revenge mock my destruction!

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: This is All-Souls' day, fellows, is it not?

speaker: Sheriff
text_entry: It is, my lord.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Why, then All-Souls' day is my body's doomsday.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: This is the day that, in King Edward's time,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I wish't might fall on me, when I was found

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: False to his children or his wife's allies

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: This is the day wherein I wish'd to fall

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: By the false faith of him I trusted most;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: This, this All-Souls' day to my fearful soul

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Is the determined respite of my wrongs:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: That high All-Seer that I dallied with

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Hath turn'd my feigned prayer on my head

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And given in earnest what I begg'd in jest.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Thus doth he force the swords of wicked men

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: To turn their own points on their masters' bosoms:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Now Margaret's curse is fallen upon my head;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: 'When he,' quoth she, 'shall split thy heart with sorrow,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Remember Margaret was a prophetess.'

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Come, sirs, convey me to the block of shame;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Wrong hath but wrong, and blame the due of blame.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Exeunt
